dmca.title: [Fwd: [ABUSE] (no subject)]
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Scott [mailto:scott@ripside.com] 
Sent: Monday, March 13, 2006 11:51 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: RE: [Fwd: [ABUSE] (no subject)]

I can provide login information to access our site if you wish to see
examples of the stolen graphics and gameplay (it's a 100% copy aside from a
single character graphic).

As the game is freeware, we support "fan sites" and the like, but these
people don't have permission at all to duplicate our game, use our
graphics/gameplay concepts, etc.

Again, the Wayback machine (Internet Archive) will show that our site has
been in existence for over 6 years.

Thanks,
Scott

-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf Of
The Planet Policy Enforcement
Sent: Monday, March 13, 2006 11:28 AM
To: scott@ripside.com; copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: [Fwd: [ABUSE] (no subject)]

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at the
address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- -------- Original Message --------
Subject:         [ABUSE] (no subject)
Date:         Mon, 13 Mar 2006 10:09:31 -0600
From:         Scott <scott@ripside.com>
To:         <abuse@theplanet.com>



The site PlayPetz.com, hosted through your service, is in direct and
intentional violation of copyrighted material from
http://petz.pokemonvillage.com, a game website which has been online for
over 6 years. Gameplay concepts, graphics, themes, and more have all been
taken directly from our popular online RPG.



The Internet Archive will show the past existing of our site since 2000.



I?ve also contacted the domain registrar responsible for the address.



This website needs to be shut down while we address any legal action that
we're going to take.



Scott Smith

President,

Ripside Interactive, Inc.



Scott S.

Ripside Interactive, Inc.

http://www.ripside.com/

scott@ripside.com




- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNATURE-----

Comment: Using GnuPG with Thunderbird - http://enigmail.mozdev.org
